result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio D Nickelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for two (2) days time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by the first 90 days of probation. Cash bail to apply.  Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed.
Court will consider expungement if defendant successfully completes the probation sentence.
Agency to look to terminate probation after one year.

timeConds.notes: At an agency which brings peace in the community.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio D Nickelson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF FAILURE TO MEET CONDITIONS FOR EXPUNGEMENT RECEIVED AND FILED. OS

Defendant Antonio D Nickelson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Antonio D Nickelson in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk
Sentencing hearing on revocation proceeded in conjunction with defendant's sentencing hearing on case no. 16CM1854
Sentencing statements heard.
Court ordered defendant to serve 29 days in the House of Correction, with 103 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
This sentence is consecutive to 16CM1854
Filed:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
COURT WILL BE PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION (HOC) FOR THE SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION HEARING IN BRANCH 31.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke not in court, Defendant Antonio D Nickelson not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lamke informed the court that his client has a pending plea and sentencing in Judge Hannah Dugan's court on 09-08-2016 at 01:30 pm. Attorney Lamke requesting this case be placed before Judge Hannah Dugan to follow with the 16CM001854. Court does not object to case being transfered to Branch 31.  Sentencing Hearing on revocation scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing afer revocation in Branch 45 on August 5, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case is assigned to the Honorable Jean Kies, Branch 45 in Room 615 of the Courthouse.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Awaiting response from Public defender appointed attorney to schedule sentencing after revocation hearing.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Antonio D Nickelson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court ordered sentence WITHHELD with credit for 2 (two) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years:


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
      *  Successfully complete (200) hours of community
          service at an agency which brings peace in the community.
      *  Agency to look to terminate probation after 1 year.
      *  Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by
           the 1st 90 days of probation, cash bail to apply. 
          Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an 
          entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed.
 .
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes the probation sentence. 
     
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights; received and filed.

Defendant Antonio D Nickelson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 31. All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserved Branch, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse. Court ordered DNA surcharge after today's proceedings. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio D Nickelson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel, new attorney present. Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio D Nickelson in court pro-se.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel. Defendant is not public defender eligible. Pro-se defendant given additional time to retain private counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for status of counse in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio D Nickelson in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. Defendant does not qualify for public defender services. Defendant was given additional time by the Court to retain private counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, or any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Prior: 2773 N. 5th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Defendant Antonio D Nickelson in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/29/15 @ 1:30pm
